description: Unique triangle such that (1) every positive integer occurs exactly once; (2) row n consists of n consecutive numbers; (3) odd-numbered rows are increasing; and (4) even-numbered rows are decreasing.
comments: Self-inverse permutation of the natural numbers.Mirror image of triangle in A056023 . [_Philippe Del√©ham_, Apr 04 2009]a(n) is a pairing function: a function that reversibly maps Z^{+} x Z^{+} onto Z^{+}, where Z^{+} is the set of integer positive numbers. - Boris Putievskiy, Dec 24 2012For generalizations see A218890, A213927. - Boris Putievskiy, Mar 10 2013
